intro: Scleria verrucosa, commonly known as the疣茎莎草, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features slender, upright stems that are often covered in small, wart-like bumps, giving it its scientific name. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically growing in dense clusters at the base. Scleria verrucosa produces small, three-lobed flowers that are usually greenish or brownish in color, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
